quote: The media has changed. We now give broadcast licenses to philosophies instead of people. People get confused and think there is no difference between news and entertainment. People who project themselves as journalists on television don't know the first thing about journalism. They are just there stirring up a hockey game.
In theory there is no difference between theory and practice. In practice there is.

I think baking cookies is equal to Queen Victoria running an empire. There's no difference in how seriously you take the job, how seriously you approach your whole life.

In strictly medical terms, there's no difference between HIV and diabetes; they're not curable, but they're very, very highly treatable, and early information is power. The only thing - literally the only thing - that is different is the stigma. And we have to overcome it, because it is now the only reason people are dying.
It makes no difference how deeply seated may be the trouble, how hopeless the outlook how muddled the tangle, how great the mistake. A sufficient realization of love will dissolve it all.
When a man's stomach is full it makes no difference whether he is rich or poor.

Babylon is everywhere. You have wrong and you have right. Wrong is what we call Babylon, wrong things. That is what Babylon is to me. I could have born in England, I could have born in America, it make no difference where me born, because there is Babylon everywhere.

When I use my strength in the service of my vision it makes no difference whether or not I am afraid.

It makes no difference how low tuition is if the student has no source of funds to pay that tuition.

As soon as you do it, actors realize there is no difference playing a performance-captured role or a live-action role.

In the playoffs, the best players are supposed to play better. I did. It made no difference.
Whether I am writing about a man or woman makes no difference in terms of difficulty.
My house was a place where there was no difference between being a boy or a girl.
It makes no difference to my family where one comes from as long as we make each other happy. They are pretty cool like that.
No one looks twice at me when they're around, and 'Cinderella' has made no difference. And I know that isn't going to change.
To try and to pretend that there's no difference between where we come from is so dumb.

I am a vegetarian, and I sort of aspire to vegan-hood. So far I've noticed no difference at all in my climbing, but I feel a bit healthier overall. Though that's only because I'm eating more fruits and vegetables. I think the whole protein thing is overhyped. Most Americans eat far more than we need.

I breakfast when I get up, lunch when I get the chance. If I never get it, I forget it. Sometimes I dine at seven, sometimes at midnight, sometimes not at all; and I never get to bed until four or five in the morning. Everything depends on the news; the hours make no difference to me.
